Paper.Title: First Story Detection using a Composite Document Representation.

Section.Paragraph: In this paper, we explore the effects of data fusion on First Story Detection [1] in a broadcast news domain. The data fusion element of this experiment involves the combination of evidence derived from two distinct representations of document content in a single cluster run. Our composite document representation consists of a concept representation (based on the lexical chains derived from a text) and free text representation (using traditional keyword index terms). Using the TDT1 evaluation methodology we evaluate a number of document representation strategies and propose reasons why our data fusion experiment shows performance improvements in the TDT domain.
